data.title: AutoLoad, Drag and Drop
data.body: With many Nodes in Autoload it takes more and more time to move a new Node from top to bottom. Maybe a drag and drop feature will speed it up some day...

data.title: Exporting APK in Ubuntu Linux.
data.body:
Hello,
I am trying to export my game to apk in Ubuntu but i can't find the jarsigner binary,
when i use the`jarsigner` command in the terminal i got this:
`Picked up JAVA_TOOL_OPTIONS: -javaagent:/usr/share/java/jayatanaag.jar 
Usage: jarsigner [options] jar-file alias
       jarsigner -verify [options] jar-file [alias...]`

i tried to use it for the export but the apk doesn't run on my phone.

data.title: Physics2D: Allow to use 'intersect_point' with not 'Pickable' objects
data.body: The problem is that 'intersect_point' will not work on objects which are not marked as 'Pickable'. And this is confusing. The fix was done in the same way as it is implemented for 3D physics. Method now receives additional boolean argument which indicates if object should be checked for 'Pickable' property. I hope that viewport is the only place that relies on 'Pickable' property, please correct me if I'm wrong.

Confirmed in IRC

data.title: ColorRamps don't seem to work reliably with alpha in 2D (.tscn format)
data.body:
ColorRamps seem to lose alpha information in .tscn scenes, when used with Particles2D.

You can find an example project below. The alpha in the 2nd stage of the ColorRamp was set to 0 (also tried 1), but it resets itself to 255 when the project is loaded.
[particle-fade-2d.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/111308/particle-fade-2d.zip)

[Video without alpha (appears when running game)](https://up1.ca/#Ye0l1OOiA242jj4vTWxWhg)
[Video with alpha (appears in editor)](https://up1.ca/#vVyxHB4Bi3ydBAcXPhkYGQ)

Tested on 2.0beta with commit https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/987bfb4b5e99bb11ecfd914e80d59b9bde62e26f.

data.title: Godot requirements (and their run-time check)
data.body: Godot runs extremely slow. How find out why? I guess I need to profile it at run-time somehow.

data.title: Ability to colourize baked lighting in real time.
data.body: Fairly simple addition. Using it as part of a day/night cycle effect as shown here (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sdOZBs28a-s). By no means a subsititute for a proper indirect lighting simulation, but still more convincing than just a flat tint.

data.title: .tscn cannot save floats in exponential format
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. New scene
2. Add a Node2D root, and a sprite + an animation player
3. Make a new (autoplay) animation, and animate sprite:transform/scale
4. Set sprite's scale to `(0,0)`, it will be changed to some healthy minimum, and add keyframe
5. Move the animation player to another time, and add keyframe for `(1,1)`
6. Play the animation in the editor -> everything works just fine (sprite starts "invisible", finishes normal)
7. Save as `.xscn` and play that scene only -> everything works just fine
8. Save as `.tscn` and play that scene only -> sprite starts big, finishes normal
9. Edit first key frame manually to become `(0,0)` and not `(0.00001,0.00001)` (this is the workaround ATM)
10. Resave `.tscn` and play that scene only -> everything works just fine

I think the bug comes from the fact that `0.00001` is saved as `1e-05`, but read as `105` in game, because:
- When printing the scale every `_fixed_process`, I got:

```
# .xscn (step 7)
0.00001,0.00001
0.00001,0.00001
#...
1,1
# .tscn (step 8)
105,105
105,105

#...
1,1
```
- Comparing the corresponding lines between the files:

```
# .tscn (step 8)
tracks/1/interp = 1
tracks/1/keys = { "cont":true, "times":FloatArray( 0, 0.6 ), "transitions":FloatArray( 1, 1 ), "values":[ Vector2( 1e-05, 1e-05 ), Vector2( 1, 1 ) ] }

# .xscn (step 7)
                <int name="tracks/1/interp"> 1 </int>
                <dictionary name="tracks/1/keys" shared="false">
                        <string> "cont" </string>
                        <bool> True </bool>
                        <string> "times" </string>
                        <real_array  len="2">                           0, 0.6 </real_array>
                        <string> "transitions" </string>
                        <real_array  len="2">                           1, 1 </real_array>
                        <string> "values" </string>
                        <array  len="2" shared="false">
                                <vector2> 1e-05, 1e-05 </vector2>
                                <vector2> 1, 1 </vector2>
                        </array>
                </dictionary>
```

Also, are is a few screenshots of the bug:
- While the animation is running: (it also animates opacity, so it is semi-transparent)
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/12702179/19f5e15e-c829-11e5-81de-de12c41b77b4.png)
- After the animation ran: (look at this circle)
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5276727/12702182/31e0581c-c829-11e5-96fa-0af2ff6704cd.png)

data.title: BakedLightInstance crashes editor if textures are not square
data.body:
I'm using BakedLightInstance for baking some ligths.
Some models contained in a MeshLibrary have not-square textures (for example 256x512).
Editor crashes  with error  "malloc(): memory corruption: 0x10735708 ***".
It hapens on linux 32 and 64 bit.
Same models with square textures bake just fine.

data.title: Godot crash on Window switch while game running
data.body:
running:

```
/home/.../projects/games/godot/bin/godot.x11.tools.64 -path /home/.../projects/games/client -rdebug localhost:6007 -p 128x100 res://main.scn
ERROR: set_item_checked: Index p_idx out of size (items.size()).
   At: scene/gui/popup_menu.cpp:591.
********* listening on port 6007
OK! 17
has connection!
has connection!
shit?: Connection reset by peer
ERROR: read: Server disconnected!

   At: drivers/unix/stream_peer_tcp_posix.cpp:276.
pre-removing print handler...
removing print handler...
found
print handler list is (nil)
```

OS Ubuntu 14 - 64bit
1.Start Godot, open project and run the game.
2.The game has the focus, select godot in the background.
3.Game window is now behind the godot window.
4.Go to the left ubuntu bar press the godot process.
5.Select the running game, now godot crashes but the game is still running.

Maybe again some strange nvidia driver issue?

data.title: ERROR: create: Condition and grab_focus
data.body:
OS: Ubuntu 14 - 64bit
No crash.

When I open a project I get this

```
ERROR: grab_focus: Condition ' !is_inside_tree() ' is true.
   At: scene/gui/control.cpp:1600.
```

And on close that

```
ERROR: create: Condition ' Math::is_nan(p_aabb.size.x) ' is true. returned: 0
```

Maby it's already fixed my build is ~5 days old. I can't test the recent build right now.

data.body:
in the AnimationPlayer class I tried to use the animation_changed signal but it didn't work.
the finished signal works fine though.

data.title: Get touch position (mobile) in MOUSE_BUTTON event
data.body:
In Anroid device, I get position touch from input event with get_viewport().get_mouse_pos() it return old position 1 step

ex:
First touch on [top, left] return (0, 0)
Second touch on [bottom, right] return low value (position from first touch)
Third touch return high value (position from second touch)

On PC, use mouse it return correct.

There is test project:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/wtcgvx3wgdtv8be/testTouchPos.zip?dl=0

data.title: Variables SpatialSoundServer and SS pointed to SpatialSound2DServer.
data.body: The 3D sound server global vars pointed to the 2D sound server. Now they point to the 3D server.

data.title: some form of conditional operator for gd script
data.body:
Would be nice to have some form shorthand for if condition a otherwise b.

in Python you can do 
value = b if a > 10 else c
and previously 
value = [c, b][a > 10]

In C++ or Java
value  = ( a > 10 ? b : c )

in gd script maybe something like this could work
if expression1 a else b
value = (if expression1 a else b)
if expression1 value = a else value = b

possibly
if expression1: a else: b

if something follows after if statement on the same line then is the result of true and an else must be following to be valid which will have the result for false
